dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Did you see that Lucid Motors just poached a key Tesla manufacturing executive?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Did you see that Lucid Motors just poached a key Tesla manufacturing executive?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: MOTORS Lucid Motors, a startup maker of luxury electric cars that plans to start building its first model next year, hired a veteran Tesla manufacturing executive as investors and analysts wait for Tesla to report its quarterly delivery and production results.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, Peter Hochholdinger, right? He was their VP of production.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, Peter Hochholdinger, right? He was their V P of production.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Silicon Valley-based Lucid said that Peter Hochholdinger has joined the company as vice president of manufacturing. Hochholdinger was previously Teslas vice president of production, a role hed held since May 2016, a turbulent period marked by what CEO Elon Musk dubbed the manufacturing hell of ramping up Model 3 output.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And he spent, uh, 24 years at Audi before that. That's a huge get for a startup.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And he spent, uh, twenty four years at Audi before that. That's a huge get for a startup.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Before joining Tesla, he spent 24 years at Audi.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he was there during Tesla's whole 'manufacturing hell' phase with the Model 3 ramp-up. That experience is gold.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he was there during Tesla's whole 'manufacturing hell' phase with the Model three ramp-up. That experience is gold.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hochholdinger was previously Teslas vice president of production, a role hed held since May 2016, a turbulent period marked by what CEO Elon Musk dubbed the manufacturing hell of ramping up Model 3 output.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So Lucid's CEO, Peter Rawlinson—who actually worked on the Model S—says Hochholdinger will help launch the Lucid Air next year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So Lucid's C E O, Peter Rawlinson-who actually worked on the Model S-says Hochholdinger will help launch the Lucid Air next year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Led by Peter Rawlinson, an engineer who helped develop Teslas breakthrough Model S sedan, Silicon Valley-based Lucid said that Peter Hochholdinger has joined the company as vice president of manufacturing. Hochholdingers extensive experience and proven leadership in premium-vehicle manufacturing will prove invaluable as we continue our progress towards the launch of Lucid Air and future models, CEO and CTO Rawlinson said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is supposed to be even more premium than a Model S, starting over $100,000. Ambitious.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is supposed to be even more premium than a Model S, starting over one hundred thousand dollars. Ambitious.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Air, which Lucid has been developing for more than three years, is to be even more premium than Teslas Model S, priced from over $100,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And they've raised over a billion dollars, with Saudi Arabia's public fund as a major backer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And they've raised over a billion dollars, with Saudi Arabia's public fund as a major backer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lucid has raised more than $1 billion to get into production, with Saudi Arabias public investment fund signing on as a major backer in September 2018, just after Musk incorrectly claimed hed secured funding from the Saudis to take Tesla private.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Speaking of Tesla and Saudi funding… wasn't that around the time Musk got in trouble for those tweets?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Speaking of Tesla and Saudi funding... wasn't that around the time Musk got in trouble for those tweets?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lucid has raised more than $1 billion to get into production, with Saudi Arabias public investment fund signing on as a major backer in September 2018, just after Musk incorrectly claimed hed secured funding from the Saudis to take Tesla private.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. Just after he incorrectly said he had funding secured to take Tesla private. Whole SEC mess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. Just after he incorrectly said he had funding secured to take Tesla private. Whole S E C mess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: (Teslas CEO lost his chairmanship as a result of his inaccurate tweets and both he and the company were fined by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.)

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So Lucid's building their factory in Arizona, right? Casa Grande?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So Lucid's building their factory in Arizona, right? Casa Grande?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lucids factory is to be built in Casa Grande, Arizona, midway between Phoenix and Tucson, and, initially, will be relatively small scale, with capacity to produce just 20,000 units a year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yep, between Phoenix and Tucson. But it's small scale at first—only 20,000 units a year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep, between Phoenix and Tucson. But it's small scale at first-only twenty thousand units a year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lucids factory is to be built in Casa Grande, Arizona, midway between Phoenix and Tucson, and, initially, will be relatively small scale, with capacity to produce just 20,000 units a year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, they keep losing execs. Last month someone from Autopilot left for a self-driving truck startup.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, they keep losing execs. Last month someone from Autopilot left for a self-driving truck startup.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last month, a key member of its Autopilot team left to lead the development of visual perception technology for Embark, a startup developing self-driving trucks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's like a talent shuffle in the EV space. Everyone's trying to catch up to Tesla, but also… stealing from them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like a talent shuffle in the E V space. Everyone's trying to catch up to Tesla, but also... stealing from them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. But with guys like Hochholdinger jumping ship, it feels like the competition is seriously heating up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. But with guys like Hochholdinger jumping ship, it feels like the competition is seriously heating up.
